entry.content: I actually saw the description and I’m still confused. Why would I want to use this over Pidgin (or in my case Adium, since I’m on a Mac)? What’s the benefit? Both Adium and Pidgin have been around for a long time, have lots of plugins, are very stable and feature rich? What does InstantBird do that these can’t?

entry.content: Ignore the idiots complaining, this seems awesome! I’ve been a Gaim/Pidgin user on Windows for several years, and I’ve been wanting a more Windows oriented open source IM client for a while. This might fit the ticket eventually, and I’m checking it out right now. You guys should get the Pidgin developers to mention you on their site or something for greater visibility.
